CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 7, 1950, pg. 3 reads: "Voting For Better Relations - Youthful citizens of the United States and Canada are depositing ballots (in actuality, dollar bills) in a vote drive to send evidence of their friendship to the young men and women of Japan as a part of the ten million dollar campaign fund to build the International Christian University near Tokyo, Japan. Shown here are: Lula Mosley (seated), Leroy Blair, 1306 Hamlin Street; Ruth Kagawa, 4007 Cambronne Street; Tom Hetrick, Brightwood Trail, and Doris Nusskern, 1412 Geraner Street. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: unknown woman, Leroy Blair, Doris Nusskern, and Tom Hetrick, placing dollar bills into box for campaign fund to build International Christian University near Tokyo, Japan, posed in interior with textured glass windows on interior walls
